reviews.sentence: Downtown Anchorage Hilton. Friendly helpful staff clean comfortable room and nice conference facilities made for a fun productive stay. The food at the Hoper Bay Restaurant in the hotel was delicious and the convenient location lend itself well to shopping and sampling nearby restaurants.

Good Service Average Rooms. The service at the Hilton is great every employee I came across was very polite and extremely helpful. The lobby is very well manned with staff and has a welcoming atmosphere makes you feel like you are in a nice hotel. I had forgotten some toiletry items and was given more than I needed to get through my stay which was very nice. They offer valet parking for 24 a day and that is the only option for parking through the hotel otherwise you are left to the streets and paid lots of downtown Anchorage. I put it down as a negative I understand paid parking downtown but believe they should be offering cheaper rates than other lots for guests. The actual room was nothing great actually I have stayed in more generic and less grandiose hotels with much better rooms. But I had a bed bathroom and TV so the basics were covered. I was at the hotel attending a conference and the conference facilities are definitely nice. Helpful staff easy to find rooms and plenty of space. The biggest downer was sitting in the generic straight backed chairs for 4 8 hours. Overall the experience was a positive one.

The front desk is AMAZING especially Jayce Jackson. Upon arriving I realized that my cell phone was left in the taxi …. Jayce promptly and calmly called the taxi service asked all the right questions an stayed on the phone until the right taxi was reached and my phone was returned. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The amenities were fabulous also and the food and bar was great also when I arrived home … I realized I had lost a bag of souvenirs for my girls. I called the hotel and Jayce answered. She checked everywhere and also checked in the gift shop and found my souvenir bag … I am so grateful for their calm and courteous service. What an amazing experience. I will not stay anywhere else when ever I go to Anchorage. I highly recommend this hotel …. Highly highly highly. Thank you for a wonderful experience. Jayce needs a raise and a promotion.

Expensive but a nice place. A very nice downtown Hilton located among many shops restaurants and a block away from the mall if you forgot your dress blue socks like I did. The lobby is nice and comfortable. My room was up to par for a Hilton. Rooms are on the pricey side but not beyond what one would expect for a downtown Hilton anywhere. Interesting note this Hilton did not slide my bill under the door for automatic check out. Not sure why most others do. Breakfast at the hotel diner was pricey and forgettable. Parking options are valet can pay for an overnight lot or park in a metered space free from 6 pm to 9 am.

Surprisingly nice. We were placed here with Holland Americas cruise land tour. Excellent location in downtown Anchorage. The lobby and tour desk area was not too impressive with clean and comfortable rooms excellent wifi in room.

Tired. Hilton you need to work harder to keep your name. Yes the hotel is in a good location and the gym is quite nice but beyond that it was very disappointing. It started at check in we are Hilton Honors and when the 3 of us checked in they gave us two watershum. welcome 2 of you. Regarding the room no fan in the bathroom only one towel hook w no towel rack very little drawer space very few hangers. We stayed for a week after being on a cruise ship for a week and laughed that we had way more space for our clothes in the tiny ship room than we did in our large hotel room. You are getting old and tired Hilton. do not assume we will keep seeking you out if you do not update and keep up with the competition.

Location awesome other things not so much Location and Staff. For a Hilton the rooms are run down and need serious serious fixing. Shower knobs falling off wall paper bubbling and peeling. The gym was roomy but man it also needed updating.
Nice location close to many restaurants and great amenities.

Pros. Nice hotel. Comfy bed. Great work out facility. Staff is top notch. In room coffee is great. Location is amazing for people who like to walk around. Cons. Rooms are too expensive. I repeat what is with the price gouging. Food is far too expensive as well 750 for cold cereal and 19 for blueberry pancakes no free breakfast. Save a couple bucks and try one of the many nearby restaurants. No fridge in room. Parking is hideously expensive valet only at 30 per night but that is downtown I suppose. Value proposition is not good compared to other hotels in the area.
The housekeeping staff was noisy and I could hear pretty much everything in the hallways.

I never comment on accommodations but This Hilton is run down dirty and very very poorly managed. The property has a lot of deferred maintenance. They almost put us in a postage stamp of a room overlooking a tar and gravel roof. After going back to the front desk and asking about the Club Room we were promised the young lady I was dealing with was n’t aware that a Club Floor even existed. Finally after giving them our confirmation number some young man who knew a little more found us a room on the 11th floor much much larger than the postage stamp it is n’t on the Club Floor but we have Club Room access. Which is a joke. But of course the Club Room is not open on the weekends 2 of the days we are here. These guys must have a monopoly. the young people that are helping us are doing their best. This is clearly an ownership management issue. They are milking the property not training staff and not investing keeping the place clean and well maintained.

Fair. Room. Very average facilities and definitely not a HILTON level accommodation. Needs urgent renovation of reception area restaurants gym etc. it has the potential to becoming one of the best hotel.

First off the staff is great all smiles and very helpful. The facilities are very overpriced and rundown. Beds are small if you get a double rm. For 300 a night you ca nt even get a complimentary cup of coffee or free newspaper in the lobby. The food is typical bar food and the views are 5 on a scale of 1 10. It will do if you do nt mind paying Chicago rates for way less hotel.

Extremely noisy insufficient sound proofing drafty windows need re caulking and loud HVAC. Heard every conversation in the hallway and every time someone in a nearby room turned on the shower. Room is very small bathroom is smaller. One side of the granite top on the vanity was not even finished. Sink faucet improperly installed it moved around.
